channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12746] [1.0.0RC0] Distributed Log Replay is on (HBASE-12577 was insufficient)
item.description:
Testing the 1.0.0RC0 candidate, I noticed DLR was on (because I was bumping into HBASE-12743) I thought it my environment but apparently not.

If I add this to HMaster....

diff --git a/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/HMaster.java b/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/HMaster.java
index a85c2e7..d745f94 100644
— a/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/HMaster.java
+++ b/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/HMaster.java
@@ -416,6 +416,10 @@ public class HMaster extends HRegionServer implements MasterServices, Server

{ throw new IOException("Failed to start redirecting jetty server", e); }

masterInfoPort = connector.getPort();
+ boolean dlr =
+ conf.getBoolean(HConstants.DISTRIBUTED_LOG_REPLAY_KEY,
+ HConstants.DEFAULT_DISTRIBUTED_LOG_REPLAY_CONFIG);
+ LOG.info("Distributed log replay=" + dlr);
}

It says DLR is on. HBASE-12577 was not enough it seems. The hbase-default.xml still has DLR as true.
item.summary: [1.0.0RC0] Distributed Log Replay is on (HBASE-12577 was insufficient)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Set DLR as false in hbase-default.xml. Seems like this is needed to turn DLR off.
Enis Soztutar Does this sink the RC?
My cluster got stuck splitting logs. When I turned off DLR, and restarted, all came up fine (WAL splits went through).

stack I think the other issue with this should be enough to sink it for sure.
DLR is on by default and has issues.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12688731/12746.txt
against master branch at commit 83db450fc634358b4f67cf9b8605bf7b74308365.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12688731

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

Test fail locally for me too so more work to do. Looking at TestOfflineMetaRebuildBase, we are stuck here after 'recovering' three servers that had no logs in them (I've seen this before... it makes us think we are joining an existing cluster but its actually clean start):


2350 2014-12-22 22:05:10,060 DEBUG [MASTER_SERVER_OPERATIONS-192.168.1.244:51070-2] master.DeadServer(118): Finished processing 192.168.1.244,50906,1419314639027

2351 2014-12-22 22:05:10,060 INFO  [MASTER_SERVER_OPERATIONS-192.168.1.244:51070-2] handler.ServerShutdownHandler(336): Finished processing of shutdown of 192.168.1.244,50906,1419314639027

2352 2014-12-22 22:06:33,043 DEBUG [Thread-453] util.JVMClusterUtil(241): Shutting down HBase Cluster

We are hanging out for 1:20. Will look into it more...
Stack I amended your patch to address the three test failures for your references. Thanks.
So the change to the master filesystem makes sense now that we're not creating a wal when creating an HRegionServer. Can you comment a little on why the other change was needed?

The only rest change is the following:

+ ds = new DummyServer(zkw, testConf);

Because we want to use testConf which has DISTRIBUTED_LOG_REPLAY_KEY on as in the beginning of the test case we have "testConf.setBoolean(HConstants.DISTRIBUTED_LOG_REPLAY_KEY, true);"

This is an important change:


240	          FileStatus[] curLogFiles = FSUtils.listStatus(this.fs, status.getPath(), null);

241	          if (curLogFiles == null || curLogFiles.length == 0) {

242	            // Empty log folder. No recovery needed

243	            continue;

244	          }

I've seen a bunch of cases where this has Master thinking it is joining a running cluster when it is actually a fresh start. This should go back to 0.98 too, would you agree Jeffrey Zhong?

Otherwise, +1 on this patch. Let me commit.
Ok. I made HBASE-12763 for 0.98, 1.1, and 2.0 with the subset that applies there.
I pushed to branch-1.0. Thanks Jeffrey Zhong Take a look at the sub-task when you get a chance. Lets get your zero-WAL check fix into other branches too.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-1.0 #614 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.0/614/)
HBASE-12746 [1.0.0RC0] Distributed Log Replay is on (HBASE-12577 was insufficient) (Jeffrey Zhong) (stack: rev 2df74fbd4a85de1e5325ba6ad8595f2081238e29)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/TestSplitLogManager.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/MasterFileSystem.java
I overcommitted adding the small fix for HBASE-12763 when I committed this patch. Leaving as is since small potatoes.

Changed my mind. Fixing my messedup commit. Here is what I did (revert, then reapply absent the extraneous HBASE-12763 stuff):

commit a32f485fecbcf7e1aa7159ac2fa9851c1bf1ae48
Author: stack <stack@apache.org>
Date: Sat Jan 3 11:03:30 2015 -0800

HBASE-12746 [1.0.0RC0] Distributed Log Replay is on (HBASE-12577 was insufficient) (Jeffrey Zhong)
Reapply after fixing up an overcommit.

commit d5f63f122131a45b24b5e3839d4b59a578652b2d
Author: stack <stack@apache.org>
Date: Sat Jan 3 10:59:58 2015 -0800

Revert "HBASE-12746 [1.0.0RC0] Distributed Log Replay is on (HBASE-12577 was insufficient) (Jeffrey Zhong)"
Overcommitted. Reverting so can apply intended patch

This reverts commit 2df74fbd4a85de1e5325ba6ad8595f2081238e29.
